title: Amazon Commits $4B to AWS Infrastructure Investment in Chile
summary: Amazon is making a sizable investment to support new and existing Amazon Web Services (AWS) customers in Chile. The tech conglomerate announced on Wednesday that it will pour more than $4 billion into building an AWS infrastructure region of data centers in Chile by the end of 2026. The investment will go toward establishing three […]
full_text_content:
Amazon is making a sizable investment to support new and existing Amazon Web Services (AWS) customers in Chile.
The tech conglomerate announced on Wednesday that it will pour more than $4 billion into building an AWS infrastructure region of data centers in Chile by the end of 2026.
The investment will go toward establishing three availability zones, or groups of isolated data centers, in the new AWS region. Amazon said it also plans to hire and develop local talent to operate and support its region in Chile.
“The AWS South America (Chile) Region will help serve the fast-growing demand for cloud services across Latin America and in Chile with secure, reliable, and efficient cloud infrastructure,” Prasad Kalyanaraman, VP of infrastructure services at AWS, said in a statement. “With the new AWS Region, organizations will have the ability to build with advanced AWS technologies, like artificial intelligence and machine learning, to help accelerate growth, productivity, and innovation.”
AWS already has numerous customers in Chile, including LATAM Airlines, Agrosuper, and Andrés Bello National University.
This isn’t the first time Amazon has invested in AWS infrastructure and services in Chile.
In 2021, Amazon launched AWS Outposts in Chile, which helped extend on-premises access to AWS in the country. In 2023, the company gave customers the ability to leverage private connectivity between AWS and their data centers or offices. That same year, Amazon rolled out AWS Local Zones to help customers connect to very-low-latency AWS offerings.
Exhibit at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
Secure your spot at TC Sessions: AI and show 1,200+ decision-makers what you’ve built — without the big spend. Available through May 9 or while tables last.
Exhibit at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
Secure your spot at TC Sessions: AI and show 1,200+ decision-makers what you’ve built — without the big spend. Available through May 9 or while tables last.
TechCrunch has reached out to AWS for more information.
Several Amazon cloud competitors have a Chilean footprint. Google Cloud launched its first cloud region in Chile in 2021, after unveiling its plans five years ago. Microsoft’s Azure announced its first data center region in Chile in 2020.

seo_agent_results.generated_article_body_md:
## Amazon Commits $4B to AWS Infrastructure Investment in Chile Amazon Web Services (AWS) is making a massive $4 billion investment to establish a new infrastructure region in Chile by 2026. This AWS infrastructure investment will include three availability zones—clusters of isolated data centers—to enhance cloud computing services across Latin America. The move aims to support existing and new customers, including major Chilean enterprises like LATAM Airlines and Andrés Bello National University, by providing secure, low-latency cloud solutions powered by AI and machine learning. ### Expanding AWS Footprint in Latin America AWS’s latest expansion into Chile underscores its commitment to strengthening cloud infrastructure in emerging markets. Prasad Kalyanaraman, VP of Infrastructure Services at AWS, emphasized that the new region will accelerate digital transformation for businesses and institutions by offering advanced cloud technologies. This follows previous AWS initiatives in Chile, such as the 2021 launch of AWS Outposts and the 2023 introduction of Local Zones, which improved on-premises and low-latency cloud access. With competitors like Google Cloud and Microsoft Azure already operating in Chile, AWS’s $4 billion investment signals a strategic push to dominate the Latin American cloud market. The region’s growing demand for scalable, secure cloud solutions makes this a pivotal move for AWS’s global infrastructure strategy. #### The Technology Behind AWS’s Chilean Expansion AWS’s new Chilean region will leverage cutting-edge technologies, including AI and machine learning, to optimize performance for local enterprises. The three availability zones ensure redundancy and high availability, minimizing downtime for critical applications. Additionally, AWS plans to hire and train local talent, fostering tech expertise within Chile’s workforce. #### Pros & Cons
Pros
- Boosts Chile’s digital economy with advanced cloud infrastructure. - Enhances data security and low-latency access for local businesses.
Cons
- High initial investment may raise concerns about market monopolization. - Potential environmental impact from increased data center energy use.
#### Frequently Asked Questions
When will AWS’s Chilean region launch?

The AWS South America (Chile) Region is expected to be operational by the end of 2026.

How will this investment benefit Chilean businesses?

Local enterprises will gain access to scalable, AI-driven cloud solutions with improved security and reduced latency.
